- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

Follow https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-set-up-multi-factor-authentication-for-ssh-on-ubuntu-14-04 to setup Google Auth on your Ubuntu target
Verify it works using ssh: ssh user@target (you should be prompted for verification code in addition to whatever auth you have setup)

```powershell
new-pssession -hostname target -user user
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Prompted for `Verification code`
Successfully auth and pssession created
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Prompted for `Verification code`

New-PSSession : [target] The SSH client session has ended with error message: The SSH transport process has abruptly terminated causing this remote session to break.
At line:1 char:1
+ New-PSSession -HostName target -UserName user
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
+ CategoryInfo          : OpenError: (System.Manageme....RemoteRunspace:RemoteRunspace) [New-PSSession], PSRemotingTransportException
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : PSSessionOpenFailed
```
